page.title: 08Framlingham, arable farming.
page.content: Most of the grain grown on the heavy clay soil around Framlingham is autumn sown wheat and barley. After ploughing the fields farmers prepare a seedbed into which the seed is sown. Plants quickly emerge and farmers try to keep them free from weeds, harmful insects and disease. Crops are harvested in the summer and put in the farmer's grain store.After processing,the grain is used for feeding people and livestock. Some seed is retained for the next year's crop. Some grain grown locally is shipped to other countries for use. Many people in and around Framlingham work on farms or in businesses supplying farmers' needs. Some firms supply or service farm machinery, others buy or sell the corn or process it into animal food. Other crops grown in this area include oil-seed rape, field-beans and peas.
